ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Continuation of the basic Polish knowledge. The professor is so kind and understanding that the material is not similar to English.
I continued developing foundational knowledge of the polish language.
I developed an even greater understanding of the foundation of Polish.
I continue to improve my Polish language skills and learn more about the culture and history.
Basic Polish vocabulary and grammatical concepts.
Learned the polish language
I learned many new Polish words, verbs, and entire expressions. I learned how to actively create phrases and sentences in Polish.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class is amazing to go to everyday, there is never too much pressure and you learn the basics of Polish
I like the enthusiasm that Prof. Illakowicz brought every class. I also liked our field trip to the Polish store
The strengths consist of a great level of interaction between the professor and students. No weaknesses.
This is a great course and the professor is very caring, patient and engaging.  More in class conversation practice would be helpful.
One strength is that Professor Illakowicz is great and very accommodating to student needs.  The course is also very low stress.

The course is set up very well. I think the material covered is perfect. Professor is exceptional and truly cares about each and every one of her students. Only one small suggestion would be to write the name of the course book on the Yale Courses webpage so students can begin to find it earlier (but it didn't pose any issue not having it at the very beginning either way).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES!!! I loved this course and would tell every single student to take this as their language.
Yes its a great language, and is taught phenomenally by Prof. Illakowicz
I would recommend this course to another student because the professor is awesome.
Yes I would recommend to anyone interested in the Polish language.

I would recommend this course to anyone interested in Polish or learning a new language/getting their language credit in general.  Polish is a difficult language generally but the course is very approachable.
The teacher is amazing!
Absolutely-and I did! I told other friends of mine that Polish is a great atmosphere to start your day in each and every day.
